p.codeblock: onSnapshotTaken?( connection: RtcConnection, uid: number, filePath: string, width: number, height: number, errCode: number ): void;
onSnapshotTaken?( connection: RtcConnection, uid: number, filePath: string, width: number, height: number, errCode: number ): void;
final void Function(RtcConnection connection, int uid, String filePath, int width, int height, int errCode)? onSnapshotTaken;
public virtual void OnSnapshotTaken(RtcConnection connection, uint uid, string filePath, int width, int height, int errCode) { }

section.p: After is successfully called, the SDK triggers this callback to report whether the snapshot was successful and provide details.
After calling successfully, the SDK triggers this callback to report whether the snapshot was successful and provide details.
After successfully calling , the SDK triggers this callback to report whether the snapshot was successful and provide the snapshot details.
After successfully calling , the SDK triggers this callback to report whether the snapshot succeeded and provide snapshot details.

plentry.pd: User ID. If uid is 0, it refers to the local user.
Connection information. See .
The local path where the snapshot is saved.
Width of the image (px).
Height of the image (px).

Indicates success or reason for failure:
0: Snapshot successful.
< 0: Snapshot failed.
-1: Failed to write file or JPEG encoding failed.
-2: No video frame received from the specified user within 1 second after calling . Possible reasons: local capture stopped, remote user stopped publishing, or video data processing is blocked.
-3: was called too frequently.

Indicates success or reason for failure.
0: Snapshot succeeded.

-2: No video frame from the specified user within 1 second after calling . Possible causes: local capture stopped, remote user stopped publishing, or video processing is blocked.

Indicates whether the snapshot was successful or the reason for failure.
0: Snapshot successful.
< 0: Snapshot failed.
-1: Failed to write file or JPEG encoding failed.
-2: No video frame received from the specified user within 1 second after calling . Possible reasons include local capture stopped, remote user stopped publishing, or video data processing is blocked.

User ID. If uid is 0, it refers to the local user.
Connection information. See .
Local path where the snapshot is saved.
Image width (px).

Indicates success or failure of the snapshot.
0: Snapshot succeeded.
< 0: Snapshot failed.
-1: Failed to write to file or JPEG encoding failed.
-2: No video frame received from the specified user within 1 second after calling . Possible reasons: local capture stopped, remote user stopped publishing, or video data processing is blocked.
-3: is called too frequently.
